'Olive oil' is a fat obtained from the olive (the fruit of [[Olea europaea]];
family Oleaceae), a traditional tree crop of the Mediterranean Basin. The oil is
produced by grinding whole olives and extracting the oil by mechanical or
chemical means.

It is commonly used in cooking, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and soaps and as a
fuel for traditional oil lamps. Olive oil is used throughout the world, but
especially in the Mediterranean countries and, in particular, in Greece, which
has the highest consumption per person.
